title: Chakkikotha Chankaran
descriptions:
Chakkikotha Chankaran (1989) is a Malayalam comedy of errors revolving around money, marriage, and mistaken identities. Krishnankutty, a timid bank employee struggling to make ends meet, dreams of a comfortable life but lacks the courage to take risks. His wife Bhagyalakshmi is practical and supportive, yet increasingly frustrated by their financial instability and Krishnankutty’s habit of getting entangled in petty troubles.

Their lives turn topsy-turvy when Chankaran, a small-time conman with a gift for mimicry and tall tales, stumbles into their orbit while hiding from people he’s cheated. To escape his pursuers and the law, Chankaran impersonates various identities and insinuates himself into the couple’s home, spinning a yarn that he’s a wealthy relative with connections. Krishnankutty, dazzled by the prospect of sudden prosperity and afraid to challenge a confident stranger, reluctantly plays along. Bhagyalakshmi remains skeptical, spotting inconsistencies in Chankaran’s stories, but goes along to avoid scandal.

Complications multiply when Krishnankutty’s strict bank manager and nosy neighbors suspect wrongdoing, and when a groom-search for a wealthy heiress overlaps with Chankaran’s charade. Chankaran’s lies escalate: he pretends to be a matchmaker, a business partner, and even a benefactor, each role meant to patch the last hole in his plot. Meanwhile, Krishnankutty is pushed into dubious schemes to impress his boss and secure a promotion, risking his job and reputation.

The farce peaks when multiple parties—angry creditors, police, and marriage brokers—descend on the household. Doors slam, identities swap, and misunderstandings collide in rapid-fire comic set pieces. Ultimately, Chankaran’s facade crumbles, but not before he inadvertently exposes a real fraud at the bank and helps resolve the heiress’s marriage tangle by unmasking opportunists around her.

In the aftermath, Chankaran faces the consequences of his trickery, yet shows a glimmer of conscience. Krishnankutty, having learned to stand up for himself, reconciles with Bhagyalakshmi, and their bond is strengthened by weathering the chaos together. The film closes on a lighthearted note, with order restored, relationships mended, and the conman’s antics leaving behind unexpected benefits, underscoring a comic message about honesty, courage, and the unpredictable twists of fate.
